title.narrative: Inclusive Private Sector Enabling Environment - CIPE Consortia
Inclusive Private Sector Enabling Environment - CIPE Consortia

description.narrative: CIPE and its consortia will pursue the following two objectives during the project: Objective 1: To empower marginalized groups and communities to participate effectively in and benefit from economic development and trade Objective 2: To strengthen the ability of the private sector to engage in effective policy reform that leads to positive regulatory and policy changes conducive for the Ethiopian private sector at the national, regional, and sub-regional levels

Det föreslagna initiativet syftar till en bottom-up modell och en lokal strategi till den privata sektorns utveckling för att möjliggöra ökandet av storleken på den privata sektorn, dess organisatoriska kapacitet och dess politiska samt ekonomiska roll. Vidare syftar den till att nyttja den nuvarande politiska viljan och ett befintligt engagemang för att möjliggöra utveckling av den privata sektorn för ökad tillväxt, samt för en starkare dialog mellan den privata- och offentliga sektorn.

The proposed initiative aims for a bottom-up and local approach to private sector development in order to increase the size of private sector, its organizational capacity, and its political and economic role. Further more, it aims to seize the current opportunity of political will and commitment for opening up of the environment for private sector development and inclusive growth for a stronger private public dialogues.

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The implementation phase period was approved for conditional deliverable including an updated detailed work plan, implementation phase detailed budget, an integrated M&E plan, updated theory of change and logical framework, and to further clarify the detailed roles and responsibilities of the consortium members. Some specific results achieved during the inception phase includes; - A stakeholder engagement was made at various level to create awareness of the program and buy in from key stakeholders which includes BMOs, Government institutions and key associations/institutions. - A process to determine the engagement of consortium partners was crafted, discussed and agreed by all implementing partners - A continuous engagement with key implementing partners, such as the Ethiopian Chamber of Commerce and Sectoral Association (ECCSA), The FDRE Jobs Creation Commission (JCC), Ministry of Trade and Industry, etc, was conducted to enable them prioritize their needs, intervention strategy and own the process from the get-go - Consortium level project implementation management approaches, frameworks, platforms and process has been established - A situational analysis (post COVID) was conducted at all tiers and was used to design the implementation phase deliverables which encompasses the socio-economic impact of the pandemic - supporting Chambers of Commerce and the Confederation of Trade Unions on what SMEs should be doing to protect themselves and communities amid COVID-19 (awareness creation campaigns) - IGF, which was a key intergarl part of the program, has been kick started and BMOs has started to apply
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
